intro: Bidens schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter's tickseed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow flowers with prominent central disc florets surrounded by ray florets, typical of the genus Bidens. Its leaves are usually alternate, hairy, and have a serrated edge. Bidens schlechteri is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
